content.description: Begin at good crimps in the middle of the dark face. Pull up to good slopers above the overhang and finish with a tricky mantle. Really good.
content.location: Climbs the middle of the slightly overhung face.

content.description: A hard sloping traverse that is really friction dependent. Start low on the arete on the far right side of the boulder. Traverse the arete to the left using really bad slippery slopers. Gain marginal holds farther left on the arete and top out to the right of Breakers.
content.location: The left slanting dark arete on the right side of the boulder closest to the ocean.

content.description: Begin crouching at two good holds on the left of the overhanging face. Traverse right across the opening holds of The Wave. Stay below the lip by doing a difficult gaston move into the layback crack/flake of Breakers (crux). Finish up on Breakers.
content.location: On the Wave Boulder. Traverses the face to the right under the small overhang.

content.description: Begin on a large undercling hold to the right of The Wave. Pull up to the layback crack above, get a high foot and mantle strait up.
content.location: To the right of The Wave.

content.description: This is the wave-like looking boulder on the north part of the shoreline. It has a dark, almost  black looking face. Easily visible from the parking lot. It has four routes on it.
